intro: Tridentea vetula, commonly known as the Florida trident vine, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, often found in wetlands and along waterways. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and capsule fruits that release small, wind-dispersed seeds. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
